00041 /* Private constants ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00042 /** @defgroup LEDC_Private_Define LEDC private definitions
00043   * @{
00044   */
00045 #define RPRE_MASK     0xF000FFFF
00046 
00047 /**
00048   * @}
00049   */
00050

00055 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00056  * @brief Deinitialize the LEDC peripheral registers to their default reset values.
00057  * @retval None
00058  ************************************************************************************************************/
00059 void LEDC_DeInit(void)
00060 {
00061   RSTCU_PeripReset_TypeDef RSTCUReset = {{0}};
00062   RSTCUReset.Bit.LEDC = 1;
00063   RSTCU_PeripReset(RSTCUReset, ENABLE);
00064 }
00065 
00066 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00067  * @brief Initialize the LEDC peripheral according to the specified parameters in the LEDC_InitStruct.
00068  * @param LEDC_InitStruct: Pointer to a LEDC_InitTypeDef structure. Please note the following.
00069           1. When LEDC is started, the LEDC_ClockSource, LEDC_ClockPrescaler and LEDC_DeadTime can't
00070                      be changed, so LEDC_Init() will turn off the LED first.You need to restart LEDC by
00071                      LEDC_Cmd(ENABEL).
00072           2. The LEDC_DeadTime number must be less than the LEDC_Prescaler.
00073              Example:
00074              If LEDC_DutyClockNumber selects LEDC_DTYNUM_8, the valid LEDC_DeadTime ranges from 0 to 7.
00075              If LEDC_DutyClockNumber selects LEDC_DTYNUM_16, the valid LEDC_DeadTime ranges from 0 to 15.
00076              If LEDC_DutyClockNumber selects LEDC_DTYNUM_32, the valid LEDC_DeadTime ranges from 0 to 31.
00077              If LEDC_DutyClockNumber selects LEDC_DTYNUM_64, the valid LEDC_DeadTime ranges from 0 to 63.
00078  * @retval None
00079  ************************************************************************************************************/
00080 void LEDC_Init(LEDC_InitTypeDef* LEDC_InitStruct)
00081 {
00082   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00083   Assert_Param(IS_LEDC_SRC(LEDC_InitStruct->LEDC_ClockSource));
00084   Assert_Param(IS_LEDC_DTYNUM(LEDC_InitStruct->LEDC_DutyClockNumber));
00085   Assert_Param(IS_LEDC_PSC(LEDC_InitStruct->LEDC_ClockPrescaler));
00086   Assert_Param(IS_LEDC_COMEN(LEDC_InitStruct->LEDC_COMxEN));
00087   Assert_Param(IS_LEDC_DTCR(LEDC_InitStruct->LEDC_DeadTime));
00088 
00089   /* Disable LEDC */
00090   HT_LEDC->CR = 0;
00091 
00092   /* LEDC Control Register Configuration */
00093   HT_LEDC->CR = LEDC_InitStruct->LEDC_ClockSource     << 8 |\
00094                 LEDC_InitStruct->LEDC_DutyClockNumber << 12 |\
00095                 LEDC_InitStruct->LEDC_ClockPrescaler  << 16;
00096 
00097   /* LEDC COM Enable Register Configuration */
00098   HT_LEDC->CER = LEDC_InitStruct->LEDC_COMxEN;
00099 
00100   /* LEDC  Dead Time Control Register Configuration */
00101   HT_LEDC->DTCR = LEDC_InitStruct->LEDC_DeadTime;
00102 }
00103 
00104 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00105  * @brief Select the LEDC timer clock source.
00106  * @param Source: specify the clock source of LEDC.
00107  *   @arg LEDC_SRC_PCLK
00108  *   @arg LEDC_SRC_LSI  : Low speed internal clock.
00109  *   @arg LEDC_SRC_LSE  : Low speed external clock.
00110  * @retval None
00111  ************************************************************************************************************/
00112 void LEDC_ClockSourceConfig(LEDC_SRC_Enum Source)
00113 {
00114   Assert_Param(IS_LEDC_SRC(Source));
00115 
00116   HT_LEDC->CR = (HT_LEDC->CR & ~(3UL << 8)) | ((u32)Source << 8);
00117 }
00118 
00119 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00120  * @brief Configure the LEDC prescaler.
00121  * @param Psc: Value of LEDC prescaler: 0~4095
00122  *   This parameter can be one of following values:
00123  * @retval None
00124  ************************************************************************************************************/
00125 void LEDC_SetPrescaler(u32 Psc)
00126 {
00127   Assert_Param(IS_LEDC_PSC(Psc));
00128 
00129   HT_LEDC->CR = (HT_LEDC->CR & RPRE_MASK) | (Psc << 16);
00130 }
00131 
00132 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00133  * @brief Enable or Disable the LEDC.
00134  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00135  * @retval None
00136  ************************************************************************************************************/
00137 void LEDC_Cmd(ControlStatus NewState)
00138 {
00139   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00140   {
00141     HT_LEDC->CR |= (1UL);
00142   }
00143   else
00144   {
00145     HT_LEDC->CR &= ~(1UL);
00146   }
00147 }
00148 
00149 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00150  * @brief Enable or Disable Frame interrupt.
00151  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00152  * @retval None
00153  ************************************************************************************************************/
00154 void LEDC_IntConfig(ControlStatus NewState)
00155 {
00156   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00157   {
00158     HT_LEDC->IER |= LEDC_INT_FRAME;
00159   }
00160   else
00161   {
00162     HT_LEDC->IER &= ~LEDC_INT_FRAME;
00163   }
00164 }
00165 
00166 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00167  * @brief Get the LEDC flag.
00168  * @retval SET or RESET
00169  ************************************************************************************************************/
00170 FlagStatus LEDC_GetFlagStatus(void)
00171 {
00172   if (HT_LEDC->SR & LEDC_FLAG_FRAME)
00173   {
00174     return SET;
00175   }
00176   else
00177   {
00178     return RESET;
00179   }
00180 }
00181 
00182 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00183  * @brief Clear the LEDC graflag.
00184  * @retval None
00185  ************************************************************************************************************/
00186 void LEDC_ClearFlagStatus(void)
00187 {
00188   HT_LEDC->SR |= LEDC_FLAG_FRAME;
00189 }
00190 
00191 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00192  * @brief Configure COMx's state of LEDC with specified pins.
00193  * @param LEDC_COMxEN: This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00194  *        @arg LEDC_COM0EN : Set LEDC COM0
00195  *        @arg LEDC_COM1EN : Set LEDC COM1
00196  *        @arg LEDC_COM2EN : Set LEDC COM2
00197  *        @arg LEDC_COM3EN : Set LEDC COM3
00198  *        @arg LEDC_COM4EN : Set LEDC COM4
00199  *        @arg LEDC_COM5EN : Set LEDC COM5
00200  *        @arg LEDC_COM6EN : Set LEDC COM6
00201  *        @arg LEDC_COM7EN : Set LEDC COM7
00202  *        @arg LEDC_COM8EN : Set LEDC COM8(Only support 54253 )
00203  *        @arg LEDC_COM9EN : Set LEDC COM9(Only support 54253 )
00204  *        @arg LEDC_COM10EN : Set LEDC COM10(Only support 54253 )
00205  *        @arg LEDC_COM11EN : Set LEDC COM11(Only support 54253 )
00206  * @param Cmd: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00207  * @retval None
00208  ************************************************************************************************************/
00209 void LEDC_COMxConfig(u32 LEDC_COMxEN, ControlStatus Cmd)
00210 {
00211     /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00212   Assert_Param(IS_LEDC_COMEN(LEDC_COMxEN));
00213 
00214   if (Cmd != DISABLE)
00215     HT_LEDC->CER |= LEDC_COMxEN;
00216   else
00217     HT_LEDC->CER &= ~LEDC_COMxEN;
00218 }
00219 
00220 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00221  * @brief Configure the dead time duty. The LED brightness can be adjusted by adjusting the dead duty.
00222  * @param LEDC_DeadTimeDuty: Deadtime Clock Numbers. The LEDC_DeadTimeDuty number must be less than the
00223                              LEDC_DutyClockNumber(DTYNUM).
00224              Example:
00225              If LEDC_DutyClockNumber selects LEDC_DTYNUM_8, the valid LEDC_DeadTime ranges from 0 to 7.
00226              If LEDC_DutyClockNumber selects LEDC_DTYNUM_16, the valid LEDC_DeadTime ranges from 0 to 15.
00227              If LEDC_DutyClockNumber selects LEDC_DTYNUM_32, the valid LEDC_DeadTime ranges from 0 to 31.
00228              If LEDC_DutyClockNumber selects LEDC_DTYNUM_64, the valid LEDC_DeadTime ranges from 0 to 63.
00229  * @retval None
00230  ************************************************************************************************************/
00231 void LEDC_SetDeadTimeDuty(u32 LEDC_DeadTimeDuty)
00232 {
00233     /* Check the parameters                                                                                 */
00234   Assert_Param(IS_LEDC_DTCR(LEDC_DeadTimeDuty));
00235 
00236   HT_LEDC->DTCR = LEDC_DeadTimeDuty;
00237 }
00238 
00239 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00240  * @brief Set the output polarity of COM and SEG.
00241  * @param LEDC_COMxPOL: This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00242  *        @arg LEDC_COM0POL : Set COM0 polarity
00243  *        @arg LEDC_COM1POL : Set COM1 polarity
00244  *        @arg LEDC_COM2POL : Set COM2 polarity
00245  *        @arg LEDC_COM3POL : Set COM3 polarity
00246  *        @arg LEDC_COM4POL : Set COM4 polarity
00247  *        @arg LEDC_COM5POL : Set COM5 polarity
00248  *        @arg LEDC_COM6POL : Set COM6 polarity
00249  *        @arg LEDC_COM7POL : Set COM7 polarity
00250  *        @arg LEDC_COM8POL : Set COM8 polarity(Only support 54253 )
00251  *        @arg LEDC_COM9POL : Set COM9 polarity(Only support 54253 )
00252  *        @arg LEDC_COM10POL : Set COM10 polarity(Only support 54253 )
00253  *        @arg LEDC_COM11POL : Set COM11 polarity(Only support 54253 )
00254  * @param LEDC_SEGxPOL: This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00255  *        @arg LEDC_SEG0POL : Set SEG0 polarity
00256  *        @arg LEDC_SEG1POL : Set SEG1 polarity
00257  *        @arg LEDC_SEG2POL : Set SEG2 polarity
00258  *        @arg LEDC_SEG3POL : Set SEG3 polarity
00259  *        @arg LEDC_SEG4POL : Set SEG4 polarity
00260  *        @arg LEDC_SEG5POL : Set SEG5 polarity
00261  *        @arg LEDC_SEG6POL : Set SEG6 polarity
00262  *        @arg LEDC_SEG7POL : Set SEG7 polarity
00263  * @param mode: LED layout mode.
00264  *                                       SEG polarity   COM polarity
00265  *             -------------------------------------------------------
00266  *        @arg COMMON_CATHODE          : non-inverted   non-inverted
00267  *        @arg COMMON_CATHODE_WITH_NPN : non-inverted   inverted
00268  *        @arg COMMON_ANODE_WITH_PNP   : inverted       non-inverted
00269  *        @arg COMMON_ANODE_WITH_NPN   : inverted       inverted
00270  *        @arg @retval None
00271  ************************************************************************************************************/
00272 void LEDC_SetPolarityMode(u32 LEDC_COMxPOL, u32 LEDC_SEGxPOL , LEDC_Mode mode)
00273 {
00274     /* Check the parameters                                                                                 */
00275   Assert_Param(IS_LEDC_DTCR(mode));
00276   Assert_Param(IS_LEDC_COMPOL(LEDC_COMxPOL));
00277   Assert_Param(IS_LEDC_SEGPOL(LEDC_SEGxPOL));
00278 
00279   switch(mode)
00280   {
00281     case COMMON_CATHODE:
00282       HT_LEDC->PCR &= ~(LEDC_COMxPOL|LEDC_SEGxPOL);
00283     break;
00284     case COMMON_CATHODE_WITH_NPN:
00285       HT_LEDC->PCR |= LEDC_COMxPOL;
00286       HT_LEDC->PCR &= ~(LEDC_SEGxPOL);
00287     break;
00288     case COMMON_ANODE_WITH_PNP:
00289       HT_LEDC->PCR &= ~(LEDC_COMxPOL);
00290       HT_LEDC->PCR |= LEDC_SEGxPOL;
00291     break;
00292     case COMMON_ANODE_WITH_NPN:
00293       HT_LEDC->PCR |= LEDC_COMxPOL|LEDC_SEGxPOL;
00294     break;
00295   }
00296 }
